attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4h8-G-wlveaX0jm2v_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4h8-G-wlveaX0jm2v_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4hDvo4JaUpLLn7t6o_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4i7noVfi2Q-uj66DI_itemcontent
attribs.current: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, using it in place of any material component which does not list a cost.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4muQMNGDAs1MzckwB_description
attribs.current: you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4n1uL9f8P0RyRtJ7f_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4n9Sixsi3IbBkwiOJ_description
attribs.current: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4pJCaoZMZ4MkuYLm6_description
attribs.current:
You are a creature of shadow, for your innate magic comes from the Shadowfell itself. You might trace your lineage to an entity from that place, or perhaps you were exposed to its fell energy and transformed by it.

The power of shadow magic casts a strange pall over your physical presence. The spark of life that sustains you is muffled, as if it struggles to remain viable against the dark energy that imbues your soul. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Shadow Sorcerer Quirks table to create a quirk for your character.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4q-CbTRj8gK1UF-sP_description
attribs.current: You are always icy cold to the touch.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4q8e8sxZxTyNDIt-N_description
attribs.current:
You have Darkvision with a range of 120 ft.

When you reach 3rd level in this class, you learn the darkness spell, which doesn't count against your nubmer of sorcers spells known, In addition, you can cast it by spending 2 sorcery points or by expending a spell slot. If you ast it with sorcery points, you can see through the darkness created by the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4qvYQdSgMOlZj1rPa_description
attribs.current:
You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.
Sorcery points: You have 2 sorcery points, and you gain one additional point every time you level up, to a maximum of 20 at level 20. You can never have more sorcery points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4rTxxKvOQ1U-gRaAx_description
attribs.current:
You can use your sorcery points to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points. You learn other ways to use your sorcery points as you reach higher levels.

Creating Spell Slots. You can transform unexpended sorcery points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn. The created spell slots vanish at the end of a long rest. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of creating a spell slot of a given level. You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th.
Creating Spell Slots
Spell Slot Level	Sorcery Point Cost
1st	2
2nd	3
3rd	5
4th	6
5th	7
Converting a Spell Slot to Sorcery Points. As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend one spell slot and gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4rj2bOoybWSR7oZbu_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level, you gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two of the following Metamagic options of your choice. You gain another one at 10th and 17th level.

You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM4s-MvB8BZkOvlYYfW_description
attribs.current:
Quickened Spell
When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Twinned Spell
When you cast a spell that doesn't have a range of self and is incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4tL73HCi9kZLUGBFT_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM4z6YyGFq8GEhcUksh_itemname
attribs.current: An urn filled with the ashes of a dead relative

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LM51UrASZxe0QGKd1iP_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

 a backpack

 a bedroll

 a mess kit

 a tinderbox

 10 torches

 10 days of rations

 a waterskin

 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM580u-hQeUhIlc5qEb_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature or object within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM580u-hQeUhIlc5qEb_spelldescription
attribs.current: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isnt being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LM59ZQiywKRRmNPq0TG_spelltarget
attribs.current: A willing creature who isn't wearing armor

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LM59ZQiywKRRmNPq0TG_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a willing creature who isnt wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The targets base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5BozuH7sNvTjAnlLc_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5BozuH7sNvTjAnlLc_spelldescription
attribs.current: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again. You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it. The hand cant attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5C2pACv8YUAZmmncR_spelltarget
attribs.current: A single break or tear in an object you touch

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5C2pACv8YUAZmmncR_spelldescription
attribs.current: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage. This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell cant restore magic to such an object.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LM5Cn8ubqUbhVkM2gjO_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LM5Cn8ubqUbhVkM2gjO_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LM5Cn8ubqUbhVkM2gjO_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the targets person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5DBkhMTq5DaZjKIEa_spelltarget
attribs.current: The space of a creature within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LM5DBkhMTq5DaZjKIEa_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and it cant regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target. If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LM5DFVSRkY9rkCfiH0v_spelldescription
attribs.current: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesnt rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LM9lA9zB2zH41ptTd1a_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 1st level, your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Charisma saving throw (DC 5 + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. You can't use this feature if you are reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or by a critical hit.

After the saving throw succeeds, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LMS3ALR6wE0gJf3ujqU_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LMS3ALR6wE0gJf3ujqU_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LMS3ALR6wE0gJf3ujqU_spelldescription
attribs.current: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision cant see through this darkness, and nonmagical light cant illuminate it. If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isnt being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness. If any of this spells area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LMS9S2d52I-EzGYvvNQ_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LMS9S2d52I-EzGYvvNQ_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LMSB8nG5kIQPRDVNo0l_description
attribs.current:
Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:
You gain a +5 bonus to initiative.
You can't be surprised while you are conscious.
Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LMSBVzObC6DPZ4w47aJ_spelldescription
attribs.current: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LO1cWXZ2gAZOxOs2XM8_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LO1cWXZ2gAZOxOs2XM8_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LO1cWXZ2gAZOxOs2XM8_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LO1cWXZ2gAZOxOs2XM8_spelldescription
attribs.current: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that arent being worn or carried.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LOG3NGjoMbVl-loKDc2_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LOG3NGjoMbVl-loKDc2_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature in the process of casting a spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-3_-LOG3NGjoMbVl-loKDc2_spelldescription
attribs.current: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spells level. On a success, the creatures spell fails and has no effect. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

abilities.name: Favorite Spells
abilities.action:
/w @{character_name} &{template:npcaction} {{rname=Favorite Spells}} {{description=Favorite Spells are the first spells in each level of your spellbook.
[Cantrip](~selected|repeating_spell-cantrip_$0_spell)
[1st Level](~selected|repeating_spell-1_$0_spell)
[2nd Level](~selected|repeating_spell-2_$0_spell)
[3rd Level](~selected|repeating_spell-3_$0_spell)
[4th Level](~selected|repeating_spell-4_$0_spell)
[5th Level](~selected|repeating_spell-5_$0_spell)}}
